result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randy L. Aiuppy Sr.

records.addlTxt: Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services

3:31 PM Defendant Randy L. Aiuppy Sr. appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. Def. has not contacted PD Office and is having competency issues. Court orders competency evaluation. Court also calls 20CF298, same appearances as before. Def. is on probation hold. State confirms and requests hearing on competency evaluation results. State notes Def. has PD appointed on 20CF298 and Def. can review results of competency evaluation with Atty. Court questions if Commissioner can hold competency hearing or if it needs to be seen by Judge. State confirms must be held by Judge. State will reach out to ADA Hays and Def. Atty regarding competency hearing.
Competency hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 11:15 am.
10/4/22- Verified with CC ordering competency eval on both cases.
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.

1:23 PM Defendant Randy L. Aiuppy Sr. appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given Atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own, court appointed Atty. or represent self. State gives bail bond recommendations and requests $1,000.00 cash bond with conditions No illegal use or possession of controlled substances. State notes Def. is currently on a probation hold. Def. does not have remarks. Court orders $1,000.00 cash bond with conditions No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
